We're an apartment community that offers quick accessibility to Boston,  plus great space,  real value and high-end customer service. If you're looking to plan for the future,  a short commute to Boston is a sensible trade off. You can take advantage of everything the city has to offer,  have more living space,  and still save for a house or other long-term goals.Our one and two-bedroom apartments feature hardwood floors,  open floor plans,  spacious rooms,  natural sunlight,  and lots of closet space (In fact,  our one-bedroom apartments are the largest in the area.) Heat,  hot water and parking are all included in your rent.At CCGA,  'community' is more than a marketing term. Our owner/management and maintenance team is right here onsite,  so as a tenant you are also our neighbor. If you have an issue that needs attention,  our pledge is always to respond promptly and personally.Like any homeowner,  we're always working to improve our property. New windows,  upgraded kitchens,  new roofs,  and the conversion from oil to gas heat are four of our latest projects. All our buildings have been completely smoke free since 2013. description: $1025/month (North End), 1BR, 1025, 37 Tileston St,  Boston,  MA 02113I'm subletting my beautiful and very large bedroom (in a two bed apartment) for June,  July,  and August. The bedroom is huge with a very large closet. Easily fits any sized bed,  desk,  dresser (as you can see in pictures) The common space includes a kitchen (wish dishwasher) and living room and the bathroom is shared. You'd be living with a girl in her mid-20s,  currently studying at MGH. Very laid back,  although we like to keep the apartment tidy.Rent is $1025/month - doesn't include utilities although in the summer months it usually doesn't go above $40/each. No fee to move in. Potential to sign a one year lease starting Sept 1,  2016.The apartment is in the heart of the North End on a street between Salem and Hanover. You get all the perks of being centrally located,  without the craziness of being on either of those streets. Apartment overlooks the Prado (Courtyard with Paul Revere statue). There are actually trees outside our windows (!!) and it's usually very quiet. Seriously one of the best deals in the North End.
